title: Eufy’s Heated Smart Breast Pumps Mark A New Era For Moms
description: Eufy enters the world of lactation with a trio of smart breast pumps
author: Peter Holden
excerpt: Eufy enters the world of lactation with a trio of smart breast pumps
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. Already well-known for its baby monitors and smart home solutions, Anker's sub-brand, Eufy, marks its debut into the lactation support segment with a trio of innovative breast pumps. Depending on the model, you'll experience the latest technological advancements, including adjustable heating, smart app control, and a magnetic charging case. There are three devices (S1 Pro/S1/E10) with varying levels of specifications and features to choose from: Warmth for a Better Flow (S1 Pro & S1): Image: Eufy Okay, so these pumps have a cool feature called HeatFlow. Basically, it's like a warm hug for your boobs while you're pumping. It turns out that a bit of warmth can really help get the milk flowing. They've got the science to back it up – studies show heat can boost milk output and make pumping way more comfortable. A bunch of moms tried it out, and most said it made pumping comfier, and a lot noticed they were getting more milk – like, an average of 30% more. The pump has a built-in heater that keeps the temperature just right, checking it constantly. You can even choose how warm you want it, with seven levels between 95°F and 105°F. Charging Case for Easy Power (S1 Pro Only): Image: Eufy The S1 Pro comes with this awesome magnetic charging case. Think of it as a portable power bank just for your pump. You can get up to five days of pumping out of it without plugging into a wall outlet. This is super handy for moms on the go—no more scrambling for chargers! Just keep in mind that's without using the heat function. Smart Pumping and Getting More Milk: Image: Eufy Baby app These pumps are smart! You can control everything from your phone with the eufy Baby app. They have this tech called OptiRhythm that lets you pick from four different pumping patterns and adjust the suction and speed to what works best for you. Plus, they've got hospital-grade suction, so you know you're getting efficient milk removal. Comfy, Quiet, and Discreet: They've got these soft silicone flanges that are designed to fit comfortably and come in different sizes to ensure you get the right fit. The flanges are also angled for better comfort. Plus, they're quiet and leak-proof, so you can pump discreetly wherever you are. Wearable and Convenient: Image: Eufy These hands-free, lightweight pumps can be worn while you do other things. They hold up to five ounces of milk and are easy to clean with just four parts—perfect for busy moms! The Science Behind It: They did a study with 50 moms who tried the pump, and their feedback was really positive about the heating feature. They also pointed to other research that shows warming your breasts can help with milk flow. So, it's not just a gimmick—there's real science behind it! Price and Where to Get Them: The S1 Pro, S1, and E10 are available on Amazon for $349.99, $239.99, and $169.99, respectively. With over a decade's experience covering the world of Android and having reviewed more devices than he can count, Peter is excited about where the world of tech is heading. He is currently packing the Oppo Find X8 Pro, OnePlus Pad 2, and an ASUS Chromebook Plus. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

Already well-known for its baby monitors and smart home solutions, Anker's sub-brand, Eufy, marks its debut into the lactation support segment with a trio of innovative breast pumps. Depending on the model, you'll experience the latest technological advancements, including adjustable heating, smart app control, and a magnetic charging case.

There are three devices (S1 Pro/S1/E10) with varying levels of specifications and features to choose from:

Warmth for a Better Flow (S1 Pro & S1):

Okay, so these pumps have a cool feature called HeatFlow. Basically, it's like a warm hug for your boobs while you're pumping. It turns out that a bit of warmth can really help get the milk flowing. They've got the science to back it up – studies show heat can boost milk output and make pumping way more comfortable. A bunch of moms tried it out, and most said it made pumping comfier, and a lot noticed they were getting more milk – like, an average of 30% more.

The pump has a built-in heater that keeps the temperature just right, checking it constantly. You can even choose how warm you want it, with seven levels between 95°F and 105°F.

Charging Case for Easy Power (S1 Pro Only):

The S1 Pro comes with this awesome magnetic charging case. Think of it as a portable power bank just for your pump. You can get up to five days of pumping out of it without plugging into a wall outlet. This is super handy for moms on the go—no more scrambling for chargers! Just keep in mind that's without using the heat function.

Smart Pumping and Getting More Milk:

These pumps are smart! You can control everything from your phone with the eufy Baby app. They have this tech called OptiRhythm that lets you pick from four different pumping patterns and adjust the suction and speed to what works best for you. Plus, they've got hospital-grade suction, so you know you're getting efficient milk removal.

Comfy, Quiet, and Discreet:

They've got these soft silicone flanges that are designed to fit comfortably and come in different sizes to ensure you get the right fit. The flanges are also angled for better comfort. Plus, they're quiet and leak-proof, so you can pump discreetly wherever you are.

Wearable and Convenient:

These hands-free, lightweight pumps can be worn while you do other things. They hold up to five ounces of milk and are easy to clean with just four parts—perfect for busy moms!

The Science Behind It:

They did a study with 50 moms who tried the pump, and their feedback was really positive about the heating feature. They also pointed to other research that shows warming your breasts can help with milk flow. So, it's not just a gimmick—there's real science behind it!

Price and Where to Get Them:

The S1 Pro, S1, and E10 are available on Amazon for $349.99, $239.99, and $169.99, respectively.

With over a decade's experience covering the world of Android and having reviewed more devices than he can count, Peter is excited about where the world of tech is heading. He is currently packing the Oppo Find X8 Pro, OnePlus Pad 2, and an ASUS Chromebook Plus.
